support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 12. Lokakāmaguṇavagga
segments.en: 12. The World and the Kinds of Sensual Stimulation

segments.pli: 118. Sakkapañhasutta
segments.en: 118. The Question of Sakka

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Atha kho sakko devānamindo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhito kho sakko devānamindo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: And then Sakka, lord of gods, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
segments.en: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?

segments.pli: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
segments.en: What is the cause, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?”

segments.pli: “Santi kho, devānaminda, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: “Lord of gods, there are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: their consciousness relies on that and grasps it.

segments.pli: Saupādāno, devānaminda, bhikkhu no parinibbāyati … pe ….
segments.en: A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished.

segments.pli: Santi kho, devānaminda, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi kho, devānaminda, manoviññeyyā dhammā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to them,

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ abhinandato abhivadato ajjhosāya tiṭṭhato tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: their consciousness relies on that and grasps it.

segments.pli: Saupādāno, devānaminda, bhikkhu no parinibbāyati.
segments.en: A mendicant with grasping does not become extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, devānaminda, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life.

segments.pli: Santi ca kho, devānaminda, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: There are sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them,

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti, na tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it.

segments.pli: Anupādāno, devānaminda, bhikkhu parinibbāyati … pe ….
segments.en: A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.

segments.pli: Santi kho, devānaminda, jivhāviññeyyā rasā … pe …
segments.en: There are sounds … smells … tastes … touches …

segments.pli: santi kho, devānaminda, manoviññeyyā dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kāmūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā.
segments.en: thoughts known by the mind that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nābhinandati nābhivadati nājjhosāya tiṭṭhati.
segments.en: If a mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, and keep clinging to them,

segments.pli: Tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato na tannissitaṃ viññāṇaṃ hoti na tadupādānaṃ.
segments.en: their consciousness doesn’t rely on that and grasp it.

segments.pli: Anupādāno, devānaminda, bhikkhu parinibbāyati.
segments.en: A mendicant free of grasping becomes extinguished.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, devānaminda, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.
segments.en: That’s the cause, that’s the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: Sakka asks the Buddha why some become awakened in this very life, while others do not.
